name: places/ChIJX5C1o-9bwokR_m9JSiKFuDg
formattedAddress: 89 South St Pier 16, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 89 South St Pier 16, New York, NY 10038, USA

editorialSummary.text: Casual outdoor restaurant dishing up seafood classics such as lobster rolls, plus cocktails & beer.

originalText.text: Great food and atmosphere especially in the summer. Highly recommend the shrimp, it was delicious! The fish and chips unfortunately the fish tasted very frozen and bland. very nice server lady although it was slightly strange that she told us the total directly (guessing she decided the tip amount) instead of letting the customer do it. please be aware this is outdoors so not suitable for cold weather days!

text.text: Great food and atmosphere especially in the summer. Highly recommend the shrimp, it was delicious! The fish and chips unfortunately the fish tasted very frozen and bland. very nice server lady although it was slightly strange that she told us the total directly (guessing she decided the tip amount) instead of letting the customer do it. please be aware this is outdoors so not suitable for cold weather days!

originalText.text: I LOVE this spot. Cobble Fish is nestled on the dock right by the water at the South Street Seaport, so even if the food and drinks weren't as delicious and affordable as they are, the view can't be beat. We arrived around 7pm on a Friday, it was busy but we still grabbed a comfortable couch and were taken care of right away. We were a party of two, but saw a lot of larger parties easily accommodated. We loved every cocktail we tried, and don't sleep on the fish tacos- trust. Overall it was a great vibe, the DJ helped to set the tone for the weekend. Will def be one of my summer spots.

text.text: I LOVE this spot. originalText.text: I was expecting this spot to be more touristy and was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't. That may be because it's tucked away on the pier and isn't in a building (no indoor seating). Just keep an eye out for the blue umbrellas. The vibe was casual and relaxing. It felt like we had escaped the city to a beach bar. I highly recommend the guacamole, tacos, and fish n chips. Definitely would return to relax and try more food.

text.text: I was expecting this spot to be more touristy and was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't. That may be because it's tucked away on the pier and isn't in a building (no indoor seating). Just keep an eye out for the blue umbrellas. The vibe was casual and relaxing. It felt like we had escaped the city to a beach bar. I highly recommend the guacamole, tacos, and fish n chips. Definitely would return to relax and try more food.

originalText.text: I think this is gonna be a go to spot when it gets warmer.  The lobster roll is worth it and it's pretty big compared to other places. The fries were bomb with that white sauce. The fried fish was fresh and yummy. Everything was salted to perfection and it was nice and crispy. The atmosphere was nice especially when it gets warm and the staff was great.

text.text: I think this is gonna be a go to spot when it gets warmer.  The lobster roll is worth it and it's pretty big compared to other places. The fries were bomb with that white sauce. The fried fish was fresh and yummy. Everything was salted to perfection and it was nice and crispy. The atmosphere was nice especially when it gets warm and the staff was great.

originalText.text:
EPIC RIVER VIEWS!!

Spent the first hot evening of the season at Cobble Fish at the South Street Seaport and it was amazing! The waterfront views are unbelievable and just what we need during the warm seasons in the city. I was able to enjoy margaritas and watch the boats come and go on their plush couch seating before hopping around to music from the live dj with my friends. All around a gorgeous spot for delicious food like seafood tacos and burgers. Will definitely be enjoying Cobble Fish all season long!
